thread.title: Bees stop play in SA cricket match
thread.title_full: Bees stop play in SA cricket match

title: Bees stop play in SA cricket match
text:
Read more about sharing. A groundsman uses a fire extinguisher to disperse the bees at the Wanderers A swarm of bees stopped play midway through Sri Lanka's innings in the third one-day international against South Africa in Johannesburg. 
The bees disrupted play twice - sending players diving to the ground - before the game was officially stopped in the 27th over, with Sri Lanka on 117-4. 
A groundsman used a fire extinguisher to try and disperse the bees, before a beekeeper was called to the Wanderers. 
Play was able to restart an hour and five minutes later after the delay.
